definition: The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: At the end of the play he was very happy because she married a good young man.
sentences.chinese: 剧终时他很高兴，因为她与一个很好的年轻人结了婚。

sentences.english: At the of the play Hamlet avenged his fathers death on the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 剧终时哈姆雷特死凶手，报了父之仇。
讲故事时间结束了，剧终。

sentences.english: At the end of the play, Hamlet avenged his father's death upon the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 剧终时，汉姆莱特杀死凶手，为父亲报了仇。

sentences.english: After the play the actors and actresses took five curtain calls.
sentences.chinese: 剧终后演员们谢幕达五次之多。

definition: to quit watching a TV series
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
(coll.) (of an actor with a bit part) to receive a boxed meal when one's job is done (phrase used e.g. by movie viewers when a character dies)
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
(of a theater) to empty/(of a show) to end
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
the curtain drops/the end of the show
